result.execSummary:
The defendant Samuel R Osornio was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.dispoDesc: Defendant sentenced after probation was revoked.
judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Samuel R Osornio

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: to Court from DOC regarding sentence credit

Defendant Samuel R Osornio in court with attorney Timothy C. Henney.  Defendant Samuel R Osornio in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
14CF27, 15CF85 & 15CM173 tracking together:
Atty Hendee states that all parties have received a copy of the revocation packet.  Atty Hendee states that the underwriter did not include Ct. 1 in 15CF85 as this was a DPA that was revoked on August 18th.  Atty Henney received a copy of the revocation packet and have no changes.  
Atty Hendee states that the defendant has been sentenced now on the Adams County cases.  Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations.  
Atty Henney makes sentencing arguments.

BY THE COURT:  
14CF27: Court orders 3 years in the Wisconsin State Prison System with 2 years Initial Confinement and 1 year Extended Supervision with conditions; concurrent to Adams County sentence and any other sentence the court orders:
Credit = 241 days
Court Costs = $268.00
Restitution to be paid through Probation or Extended Supervision
Comply with any and all treatment recommended by the Agent
Comliance with all rules and regulations while on Extended Supervision
Eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program
Eligible for Substance Abuse Program

15CF85:  Ct. 1:  Withhold Sentece; 24 months Probation with conditions; consecutive to the sentence the court is imposing:
Credit = 126 days if revoked
Court Costs = $268.00
DNA Sample + $250 Surcharge
Ct. 2:  Court orders 9 months in the Marquette County Jail; concurrent to any other sentence
Court Costs = $268.00

15CM173:  Court orders 9 months in the Marquette County Jail; concurrent to any other sentence
Court Costs = $243.00
Sentencing hearing on revocation on October 19, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
In Support of Motion In Support of Motion to terminate from Treatment Court

Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea to all the charges in 15CF85 & 15CM173.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.
 
 
  BY THE COURT:  Court relies on the probable cause section of the information in both cases for a factual basis.  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct. 2 in 15CF85 and Ct. 1 in 15CM173.  
Court approves the 24 month DPA on Ct. 1 in 15CF85.

Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations.
Atty Henney makes sentencing arguments.  
  State has complied with victim notification requirements.
Defendant does not wish to make a statement.

BY THE COURT:  Ct. 1, 15CF85:  Court approves & signs the 24 month DPA with conditions.
Court will add a condition per agreement of counsel of Restitution of $115.50 ordered in 15CM173 will need to be paid in full
Court approves the Treatment Court Program agreement

Ct. 2 15CF85 & Ct. 1 in 15CM173:  TREATMENT COURT:   Withhold Sentence; 24 months Probation with conditions:
*9 months in the Marquette County Jail w/huber, conditional time on Ct. 1 in 15CM173; stayed and may be used for Treatment Court violations
*Court Costs = $ 243.00 on each count
*DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge, on each count
*Restitution in 15CM173 = $105.00 + $10.50 surcharge = $115.50
*Comply with any and all counseling or treatment recommended by the Agent
*Participation in the Treatment Court Program

Credit (only if revoked) will be determined by stipulation between Atty Hendee and Atty Henney

Atty Hendee asks that the defendant report to Ms. Runge today after he is released and also asks that the defendant appear for treatment court hearings tomorrow at 1:00pm.
BY THE COURT:  Defendant is released today.
Defendant is to report to Ms. Runge today after he is released and also asks that the defendant appear for treatment court hearings tomorrow at 1:00pm.
from Atty Henney requesting court date adjourned

Defendant Samuel R Osornio in court with attorney Timothy C. Henney.  Defendant Samuel R Osornio in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CM173 tracking:
 Atty Henney states that the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint's in both matters & waives it's reading.  Atty Henney waives time limits for the Prelim on 15CF85 and asks that 15CM173 track.

BY THE COURT:  Time limits waived for the Prelim.
Set for Return.

  Defendant stands mute.  Attorney request the Court enter a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant on 15CM173.
  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.
15CM173 will track with 15CF85  Return date scheduled for March 3, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
*This bond covers both 15CF85 & 15CM173 (and will be filed in 15CF85).  Not to possess any controlled substances or any prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

Defendant Samuel R Osornio by video with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Defendant Samuel R Osornio in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Atty Gumz states he will not be on this case but the public defender will be appointing counsel.  Requests initial appearance be set.  Atty Hendee requests $2,500 cash bond to cover both cases.  Atty Gumz responds.  Requests a small cash bond on 15CM173 and a $500 cash bond on 15CF85.
BY THE COURT:  Court sets cash bond with conditions (bond will be filed in 15CF85)  

Initial Appearance set for 1/11/16 at 2:30pm
